div.p: Acquaintance of Heinrich Schenker c. 1921, of whom nothing else is known.

On January 18, 1921 Moriz Violin provided Schenker with Reich's address. Two days later Schenker passed this on to Miss Fried. On March 10, Reich wrote a letter to Schenker, in which he informed him of a deposit of 2,400 Kronen. On June 19, Schenker was at his apartment, thanking him for his courtesy, and requesting that the money be credited to the Tiroler Hauptbank (Tyrolian Main Bank). Reich had a wife and a daughter.
The correspondence between Reich and Schenker is not known to survive.
